channel.title: 路透财经
channel.description: 这是一个追踪路透财经news的种子

item.title: 英国克雷斯特-尼科尔森公司本财年可能减少 11% 的住宅建造量
item.description:
UK's Crest Nicholson could build up to 11% fewer homes this fiscal year https://t.co/9Wa8endYTZ pic.twitter.com/xiHAbjx301

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024

item.title: 观看：日本央行结束了长达八年的负利率政策及其他非正统政策的残余，从数十年来通过大规模货币刺激来重新刺激经济增长的重点做出了历史性的转变
item.description:
WATCH: The Bank of Japan ended eight years of negative interest rates and other remnants of its unorthodox policy, making a historic shift away from a focus of reflating growth with decades of massive monetary stimulus https://t.co/cIJSyXw6AM pic.twitter.com/xHodLZOtKH

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024

item.title: 观看：近几个月来，欧洲的消费需求一直疲软，因为购物者正努力应对飙升的通胀和较高的借贷成本，但 Liberum Capital 的约阿希姆-克莱门特告诉 @路透社，今年的消费需求应该会恢复，而 Inditex 和 Zalando 最有可能从中受益。
item.description:
WATCH: Consumer demand in Europe has been weak in recent months as shoppers struggle with soaring inflation and higher borrowing costs, but Joachim Klement of Liberum Capital told @Reuters it should recover this year – and Inditex and Zalando are best placed to benefit pic.twitter.com/ImvBdUFhzm

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024

item.title: 观看：日本央行采取历史性举措，结束了长达八年的负利率政策，开启了该国货币政策的新纪元
item.description:
WATCH: In a historic move, Japan's central bank ended eight years of negative interest rates, ringing in a new era of monetary policy in the country https://t.co/cIJSyXw6AM pic.twitter.com/S9Ska0LOhn

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024

item.title: 观看：利伯伦资本的约阿希姆-克莱门特（Joachim Klement）解释了为什么欧洲的消费需求会在今年复苏，因为近几个月来购物者一直在努力应对飙升的通胀和较高的借贷成本。
item.description:
WATCH: Joachim Klement of Liberum Capital explains why the consumer demand in Europe, which has been weak in recent months as shoppers struggle with soaring inflation and higher borrowing costs, could recover this year, and why Inditex and Zalando are best placed to benefit pic.twitter.com/qPZErhHnYh

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024

item.description:
The Bank of Japan ended eight years of negative interest rates and other remnants of its unorthodox policy, making a historic shift away from a focus of reflating growth with decades of massive monetary stimulus https://t.co/WtvfjFoXtE

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 19, 2024
